title: How did people communicate before the invention of the telephone? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well there are many answers to this, but a lot of the time they just spoke to each other i.e. they’d walk over to near where the other person was and just opened their mouth in a shape that would cause the air expelled over their vocal chords to make words. These words would vary over time and would make up sentences etc. The other person, without really having to do anything would receive the sound wave which would then hit their ear and be funnelled down to their ear drum which would vibrate and then transmitted via nerves to the brain which would decode the nerve signals back to speech and they’d just understand (well “hear”) the sentence or words being spoken. When the initial person stopped making word sounds, the other person might repeat the process, so they produced sounds etc.

In very ancient time people used to communicate with the help of bird and animals .They used to send letters or messages by training there birds. In that time people also communicate by message passing by a person.Person is used to send with the message . Few years back,before invention on telephone , post offices service established and large network of message passing using letters formed.In many sectors this services is still in use.
